Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that U.S. Rep. Patrick Murphy did not vote to allow members of Congress to receive taxpayer-funded health care for life.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence or voting record provided to support the claim.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the assumption that U.S. Rep. Patrick Murphy voted to allow members of Congress to receive taxpayer-funded health care for life, which is false.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that the National Republican Senatorial Committee (NRSC) twisted generic votes in favor of the health care law to falsely attack Murphy.
